# Content Usability Toolkit

This is a Google Chrome extension to evaluate content based relevance,
readability, legibility, and navigability. It is a portion of my master's
project and is under heavy development.

## Progress Report

### 2012-10-17

Over the weekend and the last few days, I:

* Figured out how to build a Chrome extension
* Designed the interface
* Implemented readability
  * I'm going to circle back later and implement a better method for finding text nodes. Right now, we just need some heuristics to ignore menu text.
* Developed the architecture for having each metric communicate
* Researched OOP in JavaScript (conclusion: it's unpleasant)

You can view my [code activity](https://github.com/jmdeldin/content-usability/commits/master) too.

Here's what the extension looks like in action:

![Evaluation of Dr Seuss Entry on Simple Wikipedia](http://i.imgur.com/ea25d.png)

![Evaluation of a Wolfram Article](http://i.imgur.com/mFezq.png)
